unnormalised: IIT Delhi saw a record no. of applications this yr for its B.Tech programs, up by 15% compared to last yr! The deadline, 30/04/2024, saw a flurry of last-minute submissions. Competition's gonna be fierce, bhaiyo aur behno!
normalised: I-I-T Delhi saw a record number of applications this year for its B.Tech programs, up by fifteen percent compared to last year! The deadline, thirtieth April two thousand and twenty four, saw a flurry of last-minute submissions. Competition's gonna be fierce, bhaiyo aur behno!

unnormalised: Sources say cutoffs are likely to be higher, maybe even surpassing 98 percentile in JEE Main for some depts like CSE. Prof. Sharma from the admissions committee mentioned that seats remain limited, at around 1200 for all programs combined. That's less than 0.1% selection rate from the total applicants, approx. 1.5 lakh.
normalised: Sources say cutoffs are likely to be higher, maybe even surpassing ninety eight percentile in J-E-E Main for some departments like C-S-E. Professor Sharma from the admissions committee mentioned that seats remain limited, at around one thousand two hundred for all programs combined. That's less than zero point one percent selection rate from the total applicants, approximately one point five lakh.

unnormalised: Students are anxiously awaiting the release of the 1st round of seat allotment, expected around 15/06/2024. Those who don't get in the 1st list, don't lose hope! There are usually multiple rounds, and some movement happens.
normalised: Students are anxiously awaiting the release of the first round of seat allotment, expected around fifteenth June two thousand and twenty four. Those who don't get in the first list, don't lose hope! There are usually multiple rounds, and some movement happens.

unnormalised: Other top colleges like IIT Bombay and IIT Madras are also reporting similar trends. The demand for engineering education in India continues to soar, especially with the booming IT sector.
normalised: Other top colleges like I-I-T Bombay and I-I-T Madras are also reporting similar trends. The demand for engineering education in India continues to soar, especially with the booming I-T sector.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, coaching centres are having a field day. Heard Allen institute in Kota is offering special crash courses costing â‚¹50,000 for JEE Advanced. Paisa phenko, seat pakdo? Jokes apart, hard work is key!
normalised: Meanwhile, coaching centres are having a field day. Heard Allen institute in Kota is offering special crash courses costing rupee fifty thousand for J-E-E Advanced. Paisa phenko, seat pakdo? Jokes apart, hard work is key!

unnormalised: Remember folks, even if you don't get into IIT, there are many other great engineering colleges in India like BITS Pilani, NIT Trichy, and VIT Vellore. Don't put all your eggs in one basket! Your future is bright regardless.
normalised: Remember folks, even if you don't get into I-I-T, there are many other great engineering colleges in India like B-I-T-S Pilani, N-I-T Trichy, and V-I-T Vellore. Don't put all your eggs in one basket! Your future is bright regardless.

unnormalised: Good luck to all the aspirants! May the odds be ever in your favor. Aur haan, don't forget to relax and take a break. Exam stress is real! Go have a chai and samosa, you deserve it.
normalised: Good luck to all the aspirants! May the odds be ever in your favor. Aur haan, don't forget to relax and take a break. Exam stress is real! Go have a chai and samosa, you deserve it.
